Fields.DialogueText: Helm, wake up! We're thirty degrees off course.
I am doing my best, Captain. The rudder is quite difficult to control for some reason.
If there's a problem with our ship, you need to report it.
It is hard to explain. Every time I steer us to... Chert!
Report!
Now it is going to the other direction. It feels as though we are spinning and turning at random.

Fields.MenuText: Is the rudder broken again? We just got that fixed.
Are we being pushed by the current?
Did Gromky give you some of her Mors? You can't steer the ship drunk!

Fields.DialogueText: I do not think it is broken, Captain. Something else must be happening.
Even a few knots of current would not make steering so difficult. Something else is at work, Captain.
Nyet, Captain! I have not been drinking, I swear it. Something else is wrong with the ship.
La-la-LAAA! And... turn and STEP and turn and STEP...
I think I just figured it out.
Kapitan? What is it?
Gromky is dancing with the ship again. Gromky!
Oh! I am coming, KAP-I-TAAAAN!
Ha, you startled me a bit. I was just working on my pirouettes. Whew!
First Comrade Gromky, Belle of this fine destroyer, please listen to me...
Da, da, da... You are going to tell me again how my dancing practice makes it difficult to steer the ship, I know this already.
Kapitan, why are you scowling at me like that? What did I say NOW?!
@BATTLE
To be perfectly honest with you, Kapitan, I am glad my last dancing practice was interrupted by that attack.
You mean the dancing practice where you were unwittingly spinning the ship to and fro, out of control?
Da, I think we are talking about the same one.
Sigh.
I was relieved when those enemy ships arrived.

Fields.MenuText: You wanted to pick a fight. Even I feel that way sometimes.
You were bored. The days at sea can get like that.
Your dancing was so bad, even I was glad they interrupted you.

Fields.DialogueText: Nyet, that was not the reason why.
Nyet, that was not the reason why.
Chert! How unkind of you to say to me, Kapitan.
I was happy the Neizvestniy Flot arrived because... I would rather face angry Morganas than an angry kapitan.
Oh? I had good reason for it. I was upset because you were not paying attention.
When I dance, I sometimes lose a bit of control and the ship swings around with me, but--
But what? You know I need my First Comrade to be mindful of the ship. We're at war, Gromky, not the theater.
Can I go now?
I believe that I've made my point. If you want to be dismissed, go ahead.
NYET! I was asking if we could go to the THEATER!
*ALARM*
Incoming Morganas. Wonderful timing.
Prepare to EAT MY GUNS, Neizvestniy Flot scum! I have tickets to the theater, and you will NOT make me late!
We're not going to the theater, Gromky...
@BATTLE
Kapitan! KAP-I-TANNN!
Gromky, we've talked about this before.
Did you? Proshu proshcheniya. Sorry, Kapitan, but maybe I forgot.
You don't need to yell when I'm standing in the same room with you.
Was I yelling?
That reminds me, Kapitan! Ever since you mentioned it, I cannot stop thinking about going to the theater.
Going to the theater? I never said we were going. In fact, what I said was that we were not--
Perhaps I missed some of the important words, but the main idea is that we're going to see a show! The ballet, I hope! DA! Let's go!

Fields.MenuText: That actually sounds nice, but only when HQ lets us make a port call. That won't happen any time soon.
Maybe we can go see a nice little show... after we're done with the WAR.
We're. Not. Going. To. The. Theater.

Fields.DialogueText: But when will THAT be?!
UGH! The war!
Harrumph!
We have work to do. In fact, I still need to talk to you about--
Blin! So many obstacles to my dreams.
It is settled then. I must shoot the Neizvestniy Flot that much harder to bring about peace as fast as possible!
Only then will I see a ballet in the theater.
*ALARM*
Ha! Spasibo, Neizvestniy Flot! Hurry to me! Make my dreams come true PROMPTLY!
@BATTLE
Kapitan! I didn't hear you come in. I should remind you, it's a bit rude to enter my cabin without knocking.
Don't lecture me, Gromky. I tried knocking on your and cabin door and calling your name repeatedly.
Hmmm. I suppose I didn't hear it.
Hardly surprising. Remind me to have the ship's doctor check your hearing.
I'm certain there is nothing wrong with THAT! I must have been concentrating too hard on my painting.

Fields.MenuText: I don't remember seeing you paint before. When did you start doing that?
Painting? What would your sister Gnevny say about that?
I can't believe a Belle like you would ever become a painter.

Fields.DialogueText: I admit, it is a new thing I am trying.
Who CARES what she would say?! She is too bitter to appreciate art.
Well! You should learn not to underestimate your First Comrade, Kapitan!
Pablo Picasso is my inspiration. His experimental works? Oh! They tease my imagination so much.
A constructive hobby is a good way to pass the time.
Oh! KAP-I-TANN! I just had the most wonderful idea!
That look on your face just now can't be good.
Would you pose for one of my paintings? It would mean SO much to me!
I'd need a stiff drink before I'd actually consider doing that.
My flask is full of Mors! Give me just a moment to find a glass...
Slow down, Gromky. I never said I would--
I'm so EXCITED!
*ALARM*
Chert! How DARE those she-beasts of the Neizvestniy Flot interrupt my ART!
@BATTLE
I don't like this at all, Kapitan. I don't think a doctor is necessary!
The medical officer is here to help us, Gromky.
First Comrade, allow me to look in your ears for just a moment.
Do I need to speak UP?! YOUR ears are the ones not working. I said ''NYET!''
Don't be childish. Let the medical officer work.
NYET!
*RUMBLE*
Listen to that, if your ears can hear it!
Captain, it sounds like the hull is... shaking. Are we under attack?
No, Doctor. That's your patient getting anxious. She's so upset, she's making the ship rattle.
Can either of you hear me? Privet? Hello?!

Fields.MenuText: We can hear you, Gromky.
Please calm down, Gromky. I don't want you to hurt yourself.
Stop embarrassing yourself. The Gromky I know is stronger than this.

Fields.DialogueText: Then why aren't you listening to me?
And I don't want you to ignore me!
Ugh! You're right, Kapitan. But why are you doing this?
I just want to make sure there's nothing wrong with your hearing. Understood?
I understand, but why do you think something is wrong with my STEERING?
First Comrade, the Captain said--
I know! I was joking! Go ahead and look in my ears. You won't find ANYTHING!
Gromky.
Da, Kapitan?
That wouldn't surprise me at all.
*ALARM*
Is that a hearing test? It certainly sounds a lot like the alarm.
@BATTLE
You are satisfied now, da? The doctor says my hearing is perfectly fine, Kapitan.
Don't take it personally. I had to make sure that wasn't the source of the problem.
I'm afraid to ask, but what problem are you talking about?
I noticed that you had trouble paying attention to what I say. If it's not your hearing, it must be something else.
Trouble paying attention?! What gives you cause to think I do not pay attention?

Fields.MenuText: You make the ship swerve off course whenever you get carried away with your dancing.
You keep shouting ''KAP-I-TANNN!'' at me when I'm standing right in front of you.
Don't think I haven't noticed you sometimes slinging mines without my order.

Fields.DialogueText: Ah, this is true. I must practice my dancing, but I will try to keep it under control.
Oh. I just do that sometimes because I am excited to tell you something.
Blin! I must practice sometimes! I... I will try to remember to seek permission in the future.
I am passionate, Kapitan! I have grit, and I work hard to prove myself every day!
I know that you're tough, Gromky. Make sure you listen, too.
Did I hear you wrong, or did you want to share a nip of Mors with me?
Um...
If you don't, that's ok. *gulp* More in the flask for ME!
*ALARM*
UGH! ALWAYS when I'm trying to enjoy a drink!
@BATTLE
You can't avoid the topic forever, Kapitan!
I'd rather focus on the topic at hand. Your port turbine has a steam leak, and we need to get it patched up.
I will be fine. You worry too much, and you forget how lucky I am. I'm sure it will be fine.

Fields.MenuText: It's a captain's job to worry, First Comrade.
How can you ignore the damage? Doesn't it hurt?
We must have different definitions of ''lucky.''

Fields.DialogueText: Try not to let it show so much. You will get WRINKLES on that brow!
It stings, Kapitan, but I have endured worse.
Ha! My grouchy sister Gnevny would say the SAME thing to me!
Now, pozhaluysta, stop changing the subject! We MUST talk about the ballet!
It's either your excitement about ballet or that flask of Mors that has your face so flushed.
Both are thrilling to me, Kapitan! In fact, speaking of that, I--
*ALARM*
This interruption had better be for real!
I had nothing to do with it. Save that frustration for the Morganas, Gromky!
Neizvestniy Flot! You will PAY FOR INTERRUPTING MY CONVERSATION!
@BATTLE
Your face is flushed, Miss Gromky, and you can't stop smiling. Care to explain?
Ha! How about you try to guess what it is!
I don't think a professional First Comrade would refuse the order to--
GUESS!

Fields.MenuText: Your flask of Mors. From the size of the smile and the red cheeks, I'd say half of that flask.
The ship's been on a steady course, so it can't be your dance practice.
Don't make me guess. I'm your captain, and I'd appreciate the respect.

Fields.DialogueText: Ha! That guess is WRONG!
HA!
I didn't mean any disrespect, Kapitan. I'm just so ENTHUSIASTIC!
I'll tell you what it is! I've been rehearsing for my new dance routine... and without disturbing the helmsman at ALL!
I must say, this new restraint is a nice change. I commend your professionalism.
Spasibo, Kapitan! I knew I could handle things better!
I AM THE QUEEN OF SELF-CONTROL!
Um... you don't need to shout.
Oops. I may have gotten a bit carried away there.
I'm just concerned. Are you all right?
Of course! Fine! No problem! Da! Nothing! Just, um, don't look at the rivets on the starboard boiler for a while. I...
Gromky, are you sure? You can tell me...
Oh, and I have somewhere urgent to be. Don't follow me to the engine room!
I won't fall for that one. And I may have to take back what I said about professionalism.
*ALARM*
AAAAAAAAAGH! Not now, you Neizvestniy Flot witches!
@BATTLE
Hold still, Kapitan. It is hard to paint you when you keep moving.
Remind me, Gromky. When exactly did I agree to do this?
I admit that such details escape me. The important thing is that you probably did agree. I am certain of that.
Really?
I remember it distinctly. Now, pozhaluysta, hold that pose for me a little bit longer. I am nearly finished.
Hurry up. My arms are tired from holding this flowerpot, and I can't balance this guitar on my head much longer.
Nearly done. Just a brush here... and here... and there...
Ha! It is DONE! Now, tell me what you think of it!
Um...

Fields.MenuText: Is that really me? It's... quite interesting, I guess.
My face just looks like a red shoe.
Why do my legs look like square wheels? And how come I only have one big eye?

Fields.DialogueText: You think so? Really?! Spasibo!
Nyet. That's not your face. That's your foot, see?
Do not try to see it so literally, Kapitan.
Hmm.
What is it?
The more I look at it, I am not certain I did a good job. Picasso is a difficult style to imitate.
At least you gave it a try. That's more than most people ever do.
That is gracious of you, Kapitan. And I do appreciate you indulging my attempt at painting.
You still sound disappointed.
Perhaps we can go to an art museum sometime, and I could learn more from looking at the paintings.
I'll keep it in mind, but I won't promise anything.
Spasibo! Spasibo, KAP-I-TANNN!
Slow down! I said I would keep it mind, not that we were going to--
I heard everything I needed to hear! We're GOING TO A MUSEUM for a DATE!
*ALARM*
Come on, Kapitan! Let's sink the Neizvestniy Flot quickly so that we can go to the museum!
@BATTLE
I'm confused.
A date?
We're on a combat patrol, First Comrade Gromky. Hunting Morganas and protecting other ships from attack.
Quite correct, Kapitan. And my navigation plan here is appropriate to that end. Why are you rejecting it?
As I told you before, we are not going to Paris to defend the Louvre. Art museums are not part of our mission.
But what if the Neizvestniy Flot attack it?!
I don't think the Morganas are planning a sneak attack on an art museum.
We could go, just to make sure it is safe! While we wait for Morganas to attack, I could see some artwork.

Fields.MenuText: I don't think HQ would appreciate that.
We don't have time to waste on games like this. Get a new plan for our patrol.
You're passionate. I'll give you that.

Fields.DialogueText: I suppose not... but wouldn't a trip to Paris be worth it?
Are you certain there nothing else I could say to convince you?
Spasibo, Kapitan. Are you certain you will not change your mind about this plan?
My answer is final. We can't take our patrol up the Seine into Paris to visit an art museum. Fix this navigation plan.
Fine, fine. No Paris...
Then how about Madrid? If the Morganas go to Spain, we wouldn't want all of the art at the Prado to be attacked!
Madrid is landlocked, Gromky. We couldn't sail there if we wanted to.
Oh. I forgot about that. But you WOULD want to go there if we could, right?
Sigh... All right. Do svidaniya, Kapitan. I am going to work on the charts right now.
I wish I could indulge her - but I know the Morganas will be on us again any minute. Sigh...
@BATTLE
This combat patrol route is finally fixed. Gromky has her passions, but sailing on a field trip to Paris was not part of the plan.
Is that you, Gromky? Come on in.
I wish to apologize, Kapitan, for my behavior regarding Paris. Prosti. It will not happen again.
Apology accepted. And thanks for getting the combat patrol routes corrected.
Are they satisfactory, Kapitan?
They're fine. I was about to approve them just now.
I see. As I say, it will not happen again.
Why is that? Is there something you wanted to tell me?
I decided that perhaps I am not meant to be a painter. It was a waste of time.

Fields.MenuText: You can still love and appreciate art without being a painter.
Don't give up on your dreams. I believe in you.
I had to pose with a guitar on my head for hours, and NOW you say it's a waste of time?!

Fields.DialogueText: Quite true, Kapitan!
Oh? Spasibo for saying that to me. Do not worry. I will find other ways to be creative.
We still had fun together, though! It will always be a happy memory for me!
Besides, I have a new project that I am even MORE excited about! You see, I've always loved--
*ALARM*
Neizvestniy Flot SCUM! Why must they always interfere with my PASSIONS?!
@BATTLE
I'll admit, I had fun with you, too... but that guitar was a bit silly.
Captain, the rudder. I am trying to stay on course, but we keep swerving back and forth...
Understood. Helm, do your best.
Do my best, aye, Captain. But how--
I know what the problem is. I'm going to talk to her right now.
I'm starting to lose my patience...
And one, and two, and turn, and LEAP!
How is your dance rehearsal going?
AHH! KAPITAN! You surprised me! I did not hear you coming!

Fields.MenuText: I didn't mean to scare you.
You were too carried away in your dancing to notice.
You're a terrible listener, and that's the truth.

Fields.DialogueText: Nyet! Nonsense. It is a pleasant surprise, and I am happy to see you, Kapitan.
I suppose I do get caught up in it, sometimes. Oh. That means... the rudder?
Why are you so cruel to me, Kapitan? That hurts.
Your dancing was subconsciously affecting the ship again. We were swerving off course.
Proshu proshcheniya, Kapitan. I was absorbed in my newest creative project.
Get better at listening and focusing. You're my Belle, and I rely upon you.
My project is going to include a considerable amount of dancing, you see.
Gromky? Did you hear what I just said?
Something about listening, da. I acknowledge this.
*ALARM*
As I was saying, it will include dancing, but also a variety of other--
Gromky! That was the alarm!
WHAT alarm?
@BATTLE
Yes.
It is an honest assessment, nothing more.
Captain, it's hopeless! The ship is just spinning in circles no matter what I do.
That's First Comrade Gromky's idea of a celebration. We just have to wait a few minutes until she calms down.
May I ask what she is celebrating? Is it good news for us?
It's our next assignment from HQ. They need a volunteer to--
We're going to FRANCE! VIVE LA FRANCE!

Fields.MenuText: I can't believe this is happening.
Just like I told you, Gromky. You should believe in me.
Calm down! Your excitement is spinning the ship out of control.

Fields.DialogueText: I TOLD you it would work out! HA!
I will never doubt my Kapitan! You are taking me to France, as you promised!
I apologize, Kapitan, but I am too excited! A mission to France!
Now we can go to Paris, and I can go to the Louvre! I wonder if they will have any of Picasso's work on display...
Loss of rudder control again, Captain. I cannot control the swing of the ship like this.
Relax, Gromky. Get yourself under control before you make everybody seasick.
Kapitan, I am not out of control. I am DANCING with JOY! Everyone, have some Mors with me from my flask!
First Comrade, stop spinning the ship. That's an order.
*Sigh* Aye-aye, Kapitan.
Helm, steady on course two-two-five.
Two-two-five, aye. Coming right to ordered course, Kapitan.
WHEW! Those pirouettes made me tired. I could use a nap.
*ALARM*
Not so fast, Gromky. We've got Morgana dancing partners on the horizon.
NYET! I will not let them delay my trip to France. Prepare to suffer every weapon aboard this destroyer, Neizvestniy Flot witches!
@BATTLE
Come back inside, Gromky! You're going to get soaked.
Nyet. It has not even started to rain yet, Kapitan.
I do actually review the navigator's weather forecasts, Gromky. We have a good chance of a storm soon.
Oh? Is it really? How interesting. I was not aware of this. Hmm...
You're not fooling me. And the answer is no. We are not going to sail through the middle of it.
Nyet? Pozhaluysta, Kapitan! Please reconsider! We need to hurry to our mission in France, and besides...
I WANT TO! Let us sail through a STORM!

Fields.MenuText: The last time we drove through a storm, the damage was a nightmare.
Do you want to know what a ship full of seasick crew smells like?
Driving through a storm is fun, but it's just not wise.

Fields.DialogueText: That's one of the reasons I want to do it. To prove myself!
That's only half true! Only half of the crew got seasick last time.
Ha! Unwise? I think it's WISE to push our limits!
You heard me, Gromky. Get back inside. We're going around the weather.
Nyet! We must go through whatever comes our way.
And relax, Kapitan! If there is a storm, I'm great at sailing through those! Besides, you forget how lucky I always am. We'll be FINE!
Gromky, I am not happy with you right now.
Proshu proshcheniya, but you sound quite stressed! A drink will calm our nerves.
I have enough Mors in my flask for you to have three... *gulp* To have two... *gulp* To have a sip. Here you GO! TAKE IT!
One of these days, I just might have to...
*ALARM*
Too late! I'll finish yours for you. Let's start SHOOTING!
@BATTLE
You have such a serious look on your face, Kapitan. Is something wrong?
I wanted to discuss our mission, in a private setting, to make sure you pay attention.
Ugh! That sounds worse than serious. It feels like I am in trouble.

Fields.MenuText: Sometimes I worry about you. I care about you, and I don't want you to get hurt.
You need to focus on what's important, or we'll never complete our mission.
Unless you learn to listen and pay attention, you put the crew at risk.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh... That is sweet like Mors, Kapitan. I care about you, too!
You should know that I care a great deal about our mission!
The crew faces risk every day the Neizvestniy Flot is at sea, but I understand what you mean.
Our mission is going to take us near France, and I don't want you being too distracted.
Why, Kapitan, whatever do you mean? Distracted? Me?
I know that you're excited about Paris, and--
PARIS! ART MUSEUMS! BALLET! TAKE ME ON A HUNDRED DATES! AAAAAAAAGGHHH!
My apologies for the outburst. I could not control myself, Kapitan.
Ah. I think I see what you mean. I promise I will do my best to stay focused on the mission.
*ALARM*
It would be easier to concentrate without THAT happening all of the time. Battle stations!
@BATTLE
Kapitan! KAP-I-TANNN!
Maintenance on all guns and our mine sling is completed, Kapitan. Reporting as ordered for the mission briefing.
You're a few minutes late. Did you lose track of time or get distracted?
Nyet! Maintenance took a bit longer than expected, and I needed to ensure our weapons were ready.
Then listen up. Several of our ships have recently been hit by surprise Morgana attacks near Le Havre.
A critical waterway. That's the way to enter the Seine River, which goes to...
TO PARIS! I just KNEW we would be called upon to defend Paris!
Focus, Gromky.
Da, yes, of course. So then, how many Neizvestniy Flot hags? Which ones? What did they look like?
HQ has almost no intel on the attackers - just a long list of destroyers and cruisers that were heavily damaged.
Nevozmozhno. That is impossible.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe they were confused and accidentally shot at each other by mistake.
Not if their victims never saw them coming. Or going.
It's a hoax.

Fields.DialogueText: If any of those ships had Belles, that wouldn't happen, Kapitan.
They'd have to be exceptionally stealthy, Kapitan.
Would HQ really do that? There must be some truth to this, Kapitan.
Whatever's going on, HQ needs us to investigate, and to be ready for a stealthy foe.
I know my hydrophones are not always reliable, but at slow speeds I should be able to detect something.
That's the strategy. Once in the mission area, we go slow and listen carefully to avoid getting ambushed.
Look at the chart, then. I would have to patrol a pattern that will cover--
*ALARM*
Not now, Neizvestniy Flot! CHERT! Don't you know we are in the middle of something IMPORTANT here?!
@BATTLE
KAP-I-TANNN! I have the charts ready!
AH!
Oops. Did I surprise you?
I... I just didn't know you were standing right behind me when I came up to the bridge.
My apologies. I was just excited to see you. It's time to show you my patrol plan to catch those stealthy Morganas.
First things first. Hand me that rag, would you? I spilled coffee on the deck when you startled me.
Admit it, Kapitan, you are getting more used to me!

Fields.MenuText: I'll never get used to spilling perfectly good coffee.
My nerves certainly aren't!
It didn't take me long to become fond of you, Gromky, but that isn't the point.

Fields.DialogueText: Da, that is true. But you didn't drop the cup, like last time!
Well, we must always be ready for surprises! The Neizvestniy Flot will not give us much warning.
Oh! I... Wait! What is the point, then? You make it difficult to focus on the work, but I will try.
I have marked the chart here and here. If we make a series of low-speed runs between them...
That should optimize our chances of catching those sneaky Morganas. Good work, Gromky.
You really think so? SPASIBO, KAPITAN! I always want to make you proud of me.
Oh, and one other thing.
Anything for my sweet kapitan!
Can you find me another cup of coffee?
*ALARM*
No time for that! We have a fight on our hands!
@BATTLE
Rudder amidships. Engines ahead making two knots, Captain.
Very well, Helm.
Quiet on the bridge! I am concentrating!

Fields.MenuText: Don't snap at the helmsman, Gromky. They have to make standard reports.
Sorry, Gromky. I forgot you are listening for those Morganas.
You won't hear anything if you keep shouting, Gromky.

Fields.DialogueText: Prosti. I apologize, but please be quieter if you can.
Of course I am! It's our mission!
Right, da, of course. I am just a bit frustrated.
I cannot defend France from attack if I cannot find our target in Le Havre.
Continue the patrol, Gromky. Nice and slow.
There! I hear it! Helm, come to course three-zero-five!
Coming to course three-zero-five as ordered.
What do you hear, Gromky?
Something strange... the Neizvestniy Flot must be using a new code of some sort. It is all clicks and whistles.
Clicks and whistles?
It is getting louder. They're getting closer!
The lookouts haven't reported anything that close.
I can hear it! Close aboard!
The only thing the lookouts can see is... Ah.
BATTLE STATIONS!
Belay that order, and secure from battle stations. Gromky, you just detected a dolphin.
UUUGGGHHH! I can't believe that my sonar equipment is so BAD!
Calm down, Gromky. We can only do our best out here. If you--
Wait! I can sense something else out there... and it's NOT a dolphin. It's...
@BATTLE
I should be back on the bridge listening for our target, Kapitan. Why did you pull me aside?
You need to take a break. Just a few minutes.
That last skirmish was just a normal Neizvestniy Flot patrol, not our mission. The true targets are still out there!
Just relax and recover.
I am not sure about that, Kapitan.

Fields.MenuText: You're getting too frustrated. You won't detect our target until you calm down.
You don't have to prove yourself to me. I'm already a big fan of yours.
Everybody has to take a break sometimes.

Fields.DialogueText: That is true. My agitation is making it worse.
How sweet of you, Kapitan... but I must always work hard to overcome the faults of my class. That takes extra effort!
I am not everybody!
We can all see how hard you are working.
Really?
Let the sonar operators take over for a moment. When you are rested, you can come back and do a better job.
I won't need long. Just a few minutes...
Good.
And maybe a nip of Mors to settle my nerves a bit.
Oh?
Ah, perhaps not. Perhaps I will save my flask to celebrate later.
Rest up, Gromky. If the operators find anything, you know they will call you.
Spasibo, Kapitan. I appreciate that.
@BATTLE
Kapitan, I have been driving slowly from waypoint to waypoint. So far, we have only detected civilian traffic.
And one dolphin.
Ha. Da, and a dolphin. Do you think we need to change our strategy?

Fields.MenuText: Stick to the plan. It's still our best one.
Repeating a strategy and expecting different results is folly. Let's try something new.
Did you have a better idea?

Fields.DialogueText: I will try to keep faith, Kapitan.
What did you have in mind, Kapitan?
I was about to propose new waypoints. Follow me to the chart, and I will show you.
I am anxious to see some results soon.
As am I, Gromky. Our target is prowling this area undetected, and it's only a matter of time before they strike again.
Do you think that--
*BOOM*
Where did that come from? Anybody see the Morganas that shot us?
OW! That blast... like a punch in my stomach... Ooof...
Can you fight?
I just... needed a second to catch my breath. All right. Now my mine sling is READY TO FIRE!
There she is! We've spotted her from that shot. Fire at will, Gromky!
@BATTLE
Whew. I feel a bit winded from that fight, Kapitan.
Just tell me if you're all right.
When you show me that you care, I feel better already... but I have plenty of fight left! Those Neizvestniy Flot backstabbers took their best shot, but we're still afloat.
Good. We drove them off, but we have to kick them out of Le Havre for good.
STILL AFLOAT! Do you HEAR ME?! HA-HA! Whew!
Time to debrief that fight. Any ideas about our strategy for the next encounter?
Let's talk about something else for a bit. My head still hurts.

Fields.MenuText: Have you painted anything lately? Or seen any good vaudeville shows?
Sorry, Gromky. We need to focus on the next fight.
Just catch your breath.

Fields.DialogueText: Ha! I appreciate that, Kapitan. *cough* I will enjoy talking about it with you after we defeat these monsters.
You're right, Kapitan. *cough* I will try my best.
I will.
I wish I could remember more from the fight. She was upon us so suddenly.
Normally you can sense when Morganas draw near. Are those ones different?
It must be. And it makes them dangerous.
Chief?
Standing by, Captain.
Get more coffee to the lookouts and to the gunnery teams. I want us ready for the next fight.
Aye-aye, Captain. And I'll warn them we won't get much warning before our targets strike again.
Coffee? A nip of Mors suits me better! *glug* AH!
Don't overdo it. I need you alert too, First Comrade.
@BATTLE
The waves are getting bigger, Kapitan. And more rain is coming down.
Steady as she goes.
Kapitan! KAP-I-TANNN! The navigator has wonderful news!
Did you hear the weather forecast update? We have a chance of a storm!
That does not sound like good news to me. I hate being seasick...
If we have a storm, we won't be able to track our assassins.
Nyet, Kapitan! This is GOOD luck for us!

Fields.MenuText: Any excuse to go galloping into a storm? This isn't the time.
Is your compass spinning? I think you're confused.
If you can find a bright side to this, I'm listening.

Fields.DialogueText: It is not for thrills, Kapitan. It is tactical.
My gyro is true, Kapitan. Listen to what I say.
Spasibo! Now listen.
A storm will deafen us to the Morgana assassins, but that's why they will hide in it.
Poor visibility, rough waves. It won't be easy for us or for them.
We will be on even footing. They cannot sneak up on us!
So... maybe nothing happens. Or we stumble upon each other and end up in a point-blank shootout.
Da. I LIKE THOSE ODDS!
If we get a storm, I'll keep that in mind. Tactical oceanography, I suppose...
Coming to starboard, Captain.
You sneaky witches, we are coming for YOU!
@BATTLE
That storm! WHEW!
Hard to say which hit us worse, Morgana gunfire or the shock of the surprise at close range.
I know which one made me vomit my breakfast...
Helm, please don't talk about that. My own stomach hasn't decided yet.
Sorry, Captain.
You really hate storms so much?

Fields.MenuText: My guts always prefer calm seas.
Storms always batter us pretty hard.
They can be advantageous, I guess.

Fields.DialogueText: Suit yourself!
And storms can batter the Morganas, too!
They have a function, but I love them because they are exciting!
I'll have to try using the sonar again.
Helm, engines to three knots. And be ready to sprint when First Comrade Gromky detects something.
Aye, Captain. Three knots.
Try to keep it quiet, if you can.
That's something I never thought I'd hear you say, Gromky...
Wait!
Chert! I think I hear them! Get ready!
@BATTLE
My head is still ringing from that fight. I hope we gave better than we got.
It's not too late, Gromky.
What? *cough* What are you saying, Kapitan?

Fields.MenuText: This doesn't have to be a suicide mission. We can withdraw if we need to.
Maybe we could ask HQ for reinforcements. This kind of enemies warrants it.
Getting you hurt would break my heart, Gromky.

Fields.DialogueText: You're right, Kapitan. We could, but we don't need to.
If we don't stop them, HQ won't have reinforcements. That's why we volunteered.
I have some dents and scratches, Kapitan, but we will not have broken hearts!
Kapitan, it is just like the Ballet Russes at the theater. The show must go on!
Are you certain?
Ha! All I must do for strength is think of the face Gnevny will make when all of my sisters find out we won!
Then stay alert. They're not going to give us any warning.
Kapitan?
Yes?
A little quieter, pozhaluysta. I am listening for them with my sonar. They won't take us by surprise.
And afterwards, we sail to PARIS!
Gromky...
Ah, right. Focusing...
@BATTLE
Ah! France is magnificent, even from the pier. The crew must be having a wonderful time on shore leave right now.
Sorry we can't get you closer than Le Havre. You're not too disappointed?
I always knew I could not actually visit the Louvre. As a Belle, I can't go that far away from the ship.
Sorry it has to be this way. It's such a big dream of yours to go...
That doesn't change how happy I am to sit with you and look at the city. Le Havre is a work of art in itself.
You earned it. You did a wonderful job on our mission.
Spasibo, Kapitan. My sisters and I do not have a great reputation as capable ships. Proving myself is important.

Fields.MenuText: Proving yourself to HQ?
Proving yourself to your sister, Gnevny?
Proving yourself to the crew?

Fields.DialogueText: HQ is important, of course, but now I want to prove myself to someone else.
Ha! Even if I impressed Gnevny, she would still scowl. I am now more interested in proving myself to someone else.
I always want to show the crew my best, but I want to prove myself to one of them particular.
Who is that?
I thought you knew. To you, Kapitan.
Oh.
I think about how much you trusted me, listened to me, made me stronger.
You know everything about me that matters.
I liked growing closer to you, too, Gromky. You're optimistic and tough... and you go wild fighting for what you want.
I feel so comfortable, so good being myself around you. I don't want that feeling to stop.
It doesn't have to stop.
Aren't you going to leave the ship and see the city?
No. I'm staying right here.
Oh! My heart was hoping you would say that.
Pass me that flask, would you? I could use a nip of Mors.
Come a little closer, and your lips will get something better! WOOHOO!
One more pack of Morganas, Gromky! This close to shore? They must really have a grudge with us.
I have a HUNDRED DATES to go on with my sweet Kapitan, and I will NOT tolerate delays to this by Neizvestniy Flot HAGS!
@BATTLE
